questions.question: What is the main advantage of using Lasso regression over Linear regression?

answers.b: It automatically selects important features by setting some coefficients to zero.
answers.c: It minimizes bias in the model.
answers.d: It increases the complexity of the model.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Regularization does not focus on reducing training time.
explanations.b: Correct! Lasso regression sets some coefficients to zero, making it useful for feature selection.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Regularization aims to reduce variance, not bias.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Regularization simplifies the model by controlling complexity.

questions.question: How does increasing the alpha value in Ridge regression affect the model?

answers.c: Has no impact on the model.
answers.d: Makes the model underfit the data.

explanations.a: Incorrect. Ridge regression discourages large coefficients.
explanations.b: Correct! Increasing alpha penalizes large coefficients, leading to smaller magnitudes.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Alpha has a direct impact on regularization strength.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Higher alpha may increase bias but does not necessarily lead to underfitting.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the role of alpha in Lasso and Ridge regression?

answers.a: Higher alpha values reduce overfitting by increasing regularization.
answers.b: Lower alpha values increase model complexity.
answers.c: Alpha values have no impact on model performance.
answers.d: Alpha values increase bias and variance simultaneously.

explanations.a: Correct! Higher alpha values increase regularization, reducing overfitting.
explanations.b: Partially correct, but alpha controls regularization, not complexity directly.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Alpha significantly affects model regularization.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Alpha balances bias and variance, not increases both.
